name: Tokyo
description: Tokyo blends ultra-modern city life with deeply rooted traditions. From neon-lit districts to ancient temples, the city rewards every type of traveller.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Japan visa-free for up to 90 days.
tips: Get a Suica or Pasmo IC card for seamless transport
Visit Senso-ji at 6am to beat the crowds
Cash is still widely used — carry some at all times

activities.name: Senso-ji Temple
activities.description: Tokyo's oldest Buddhist temple in Asakusa, dating back to 628 AD.

activities.name: Shibuya Crossing & Scramble
activities.description: The world's busiest pedestrian crossing — best viewed from Starbucks above.

activities.name: Tsukiji Outer Market Food Tour
activities.description: Freshest sushi, tamagoyaki, and street food stalls in the outer market.

activities.name: Tokyo Skytree
activities.description: Panoramic views of Tokyo from 350m and 450m observation decks.

activities.name: Shinjuku Golden Gai
activities.description: A maze of tiny bars and unique nightlife in the heart of Shinjuku.

activities.name: Harajuku & Takeshita Street
activities.description: Fashion-forward street lined with crepe shops and quirky boutiques.

activities.name: Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden
activities.description: Stunning traditional Japanese garden with cherry blossoms in spring.

name: Kyoto
description: Japan's ancient imperial capital, filled with thousands of temples, traditional tea houses, and geisha districts. Autumn foliage and spring cherry blossoms are world-famous.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Japan visa-free for up to 90 days.
tips: Rent a bicycle — Kyoto is very cycle-friendly
Visit Fushimi Inari at sunrise to avoid tour groups
Book ryokan accommodations months ahead during cherry blossom season

activities.name: Fushimi Inari Shrine
activities.description: Walk through thousands of vermillion torii gates winding up the mountainside.

activities.name: Arashiyama Bamboo Grove
activities.description: A towering bamboo forest just outside central Kyoto.

activities.name: Gion District Walk
activities.description: Kyoto's famous geisha district with preserved machiya townhouses.

activities.name: Kinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion)
activities.description: A Zen Buddhist temple covered in gold leaf reflected in a still pond.

activities.name: Traditional Kaiseki Dinner
activities.description: Multi-course traditional Japanese cuisine using seasonal local ingredients.

activities.name: Nishiki Market
activities.description: Kyoto's Nishiki Market with 100+ stalls of pickles, tofu, and local snacks.

name: Bali
description: Bali offers a rare combination of lush rice terraces, Hindu temples, world-class surf, and an affordable wellness scene. It remains one of the world's most beloved islands.
visa_notes: Australians receive a 30-day visa on arrival, extendable to 60 days.
tips: Rent a scooter for flexibility — most areas are scooter-friendly
Ubud is calmer and more cultural; Seminyak and Canggu for beaches
Bargain respectfully at markets

activities.name: Tegallalang Rice Terraces
activities.description: UNESCO-listed terraced rice paddies outside Ubud with jungle views.

activities.name: Tanah Lot Temple at Sunset
activities.description: A sea temple perched on a rocky outcrop, spectacular at sunset.

activities.name: Surf Lesson at Kuta Beach
activities.description: Beginner-friendly waves and local surf instructors at Kuta.

activities.name: Ubud Cooking Class
activities.description: Learn to cook nasi goreng, satay, and traditional Balinese dishes.

activities.name: Mount Batur Sunrise Trek
activities.description: Pre-dawn hike to an active volcano summit for a sunrise view above the clouds.

activities.name: Traditional Balinese Massage
activities.description: A full-body massage using coconut oil and aromatic herbs.

name: Singapore
description: Singapore is a hyper-efficient city-state that punches far above its weight in food, architecture, and cleanliness. An excellent regional hub for Southeast Asia travel.
visa_notes: Australians arrive visa-free and can stay up to 90 days.
tips: Get an EZ-Link card for the MRT — fastest way to get around
Hawker centres are the best bang-for-buck food in the world
Singapore is expensive for alcohol — stock up at duty-free

activities.name: Gardens by the Bay
activities.description: Futuristic supertrees and climate-controlled domes housing rare plant species.

activities.name: Hawker Centre Crawl
activities.description: Try chicken rice, laksa, char kway teow across multiple stalls.

activities.name: Marina Bay Sands Skypark
activities.description: Observation deck and infinity pool views at the iconic hotel.

activities.name: Chinatown & Little India Walk
activities.description: Explore two of Singapore's most colourful and distinct cultural districts.

activities.name: Sentosa Island Beach Day
activities.description: Beach clubs, Universal Studios, and cable car all on one resort island.

name: Paris
description: Paris is the global capital of art, fashion, and café culture. The city rewards slow walks through its grand boulevards and hidden courtyards equally.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Schengen countries visa-free for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
tips: Buy a carnet of 10 metro tickets to save money
Most major museums are free on the first Sunday of each month
Learn basic French phrases — locals genuinely appreciate the effort

activities.name: Eiffel Tower
activities.description: The 330m wrought-iron tower — best visited at dusk for a light show.

activities.name: Louvre Museum
activities.description: World's largest art museum and home to the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo.

activities.name: Montmartre & Sacré-Cœur
activities.description: Paris's historic artist village with the white-domed Sacré-Cœur basilica.

activities.name: Seine River Cruise
activities.description: Boat cruise past Notre-Dame, the Louvre, and the Eiffel Tower.

activities.name: French Bistro Dinner
activities.description: Classic steak frites, escargot, and crème brûlée in a neighbourhood bistro.

activities.name: Versailles Day Trip
activities.description: The Sun King's lavish palace and 800-hectare formal gardens, 40 min from Paris.

name: Rome
description: Rome is an open-air museum where ancient ruins, Renaissance masterpieces, and vibrant café culture coexist. Every piazza has a story spanning thousands of years.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Schengen countries visa-free for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
tips: Book Vatican Museums online at least 2 weeks ahead
Avoid tourist restaurants near major landmarks — walk one block back
Carry a reusable bottle — Rome's public water fountains (nasoni) are free and delicious

activities.name: Colosseum & Roman Forum
activities.description: The 2,000-year-old amphitheatre and the political centre of ancient Rome.

activities.name: Vatican Museums & Sistine Chapel
activities.description: Michelangelo's ceiling fresco is the centrepiece of this vast papal collection.

activities.name: Trastevere Evening Walk
activities.description: Rome's most atmospheric medieval neighbourhood, packed with trattorias.

activities.name: Trevi Fountain & Spanish Steps
activities.description: The baroque Trevi Fountain and the grand Spanish Steps in the city centre.

activities.name: Borghese Gallery
activities.description: Bernini sculptures and Caravaggio paintings in a stunning 17th-century villa.

name: Barcelona
description: Barcelona is Gaudí's canvas, a city of modernist architecture, golden beaches, and electric nightlife. Catalunya's capital runs on its own energy and schedule.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Schengen countries visa-free for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
tips: Book Sagrada Família tickets months in advance — it sells out
Dinner starts at 9pm or later — don't show up at a restaurant at 7pm
Watch for pickpockets on Las Ramblas

activities.name: Sagrada Família
activities.description: Gaudí's unfinished basilica — the most visited monument in Spain.

activities.name: Park Güell
activities.description: Gaudí's mosaic-covered hilltop park with panoramic city views.

activities.name: La Barceloneta Beach
activities.description: The city's main beach, walkable from the Gothic Quarter.

activities.name: La Boqueria Market
activities.description: Barcelona's most famous covered food market on Las Ramblas.

activities.name: Tapas & Wine Night
activities.description: Bar-hop through El Born for patatas bravas, jamón, and Catalan wine.

activities.name: Gothic Quarter Walk
activities.description: Medieval lanes and Roman ruins at the city's historic core.

name: Amsterdam
description: Amsterdam is a city of canals, cycling, and world-class museums packed into a compact, walkable centre. Liberal and vibrant, it rewards curious travellers.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Schengen countries visa-free for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
tips: Rent a bike on your first day — locals cycle everywhere
Book the Anne Frank House in advance — queues are long
The Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum are must-sees

activities.name: Rijksmuseum
activities.description: Dutch Golden Age masters including Rembrandt and Vermeer.

activities.name: Anne Frank House
activities.description: The hiding place of Anne Frank, now a deeply moving museum.

activities.name: Canal Boat Tour
activities.description: See 17th-century merchant houses and bridges from the water.

activities.name: Jordaan Neighbourhood Walk
activities.description: Amsterdam's most charming district of boutiques, galleries, and cafés.

activities.name: Stroopwafel & Heineken Experience
activities.description: Interactive brewery tour ending with a cold Heineken at the source.

name: New York City
description: New York City is relentlessly energetic, with world-class food, culture, and entertainment packed into every borough. There is nowhere else quite like it.
visa_notes: Australians must apply for ESTA (Electronic System for Travel Authorisation) before flying to the US.
tips: Buy an unlimited 7-day Metro card if staying a week
Tipping 18–20% is expected at restaurants
Free activities: Central Park, High Line, Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry

activities.name: Central Park
activities.description: 840-acre green oasis in the heart of Manhattan — row boats, skyline views, and live music.

activities.name: The Metropolitan Museum of Art
activities.description: One of the world's greatest art collections, from Egyptian mummies to Impressionism.

activities.name: Brooklyn Bridge Walk
activities.description: Walk the pedestrian path for sweeping views of the Manhattan skyline.

activities.name: Broadway Show
activities.description: World-class theatre — from established hits to experimental Off-Broadway.

activities.name: Chelsea Market & High Line
activities.description: An elevated park built on an old rail line above gourmet food vendors.

activities.name: DUMBO & Brooklyn Food Scene
activities.description: Pizza, bagels, and NYC's best views of the bridge from Brooklyn's waterfront.

name: Mexico City
description: Mexico City is one of the world's great capitals — a megacity with extraordinary food, ancient history, and a thriving arts scene, all at budget-friendly prices.
visa_notes: Australians receive a tourist permit on arrival valid for up to 180 days.
tips: Stick to Uber over street taxis for safety
Mexico City sits at 2,240m altitude — allow 1–2 days to acclimatise
Eat at taquerias and mercados — cheapest and best food

activities.name: Teotihuacán Pyramids
activities.description: Ancient city 50km from CDMX with the Pyramids of the Sun and Moon.

activities.name: Frida Kahlo Museum
activities.description: The Blue House where Frida Kahlo was born, lived, and died.

activities.name: Mercado de la Merced Tacos
activities.description: Carnitas, barbacoa, and al pastor tacos at one of the city's biggest markets.

activities.name: Xochimilco Floating Gardens
activities.description: Ancient Aztec canal system — hire a colourful trajinera boat with food and music.

activities.name: Lucha Libre Wrestling Show
activities.description: Mexico's masked wrestling spectacle — loud, theatrical, and unforgettable.

name: Sydney
description: Sydney combines iconic architecture, world-class beaches, and a relaxed outdoor lifestyle. As Australia's largest city, it's a natural gateway to the country.
visa_notes: No visa required for Australian citizens. Overseas visitors need an ETA or tourist visa.
tips: Load money on an Opal card for trains, buses, and ferries
The Manly Ferry from Circular Quay is one of the world's great commutes
Slip, slop, slap — UV is extreme, especially in summer

activities.name: Sydney Opera House Tour
activities.description: Guided tour of the UNESCO-listed building — go backstage if possible.

activities.name: Bondi to Coogee Coastal Walk
activities.description: 6km clifftop walk connecting Sydney's best beaches with sweeping ocean views.

activities.name: Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb
activities.description: Climb to the summit of the iconic bridge for 360° harbour views.

activities.name: Darling Harbour Seafood Dinner
activities.description: Fresh prawns, barramundi, and Sydney rock oysters at the waterfront.

activities.name: BlueMountains Day Trip
activities.description: UNESCO World Heritage wilderness 90 minutes from Sydney — waterfalls and lookouts.

name: Cape Town
description: Cape Town is framed by the iconic Table Mountain and two oceans. It offers dramatic scenery, rich history, excellent wine, and some of the world's most affordable luxury.
visa_notes: Australians receive visa-free entry for tourism for up to 90 days.
tips: Only use Uber or pre-booked transfers — avoid unmetered taxis
Check the weather forecast before booking Table Mountain cable car
Cape Town has one of the worst inequality gaps in the world — tip generously

activities.name: Table Mountain Cable Car
activities.description: The flat-topped mountain with sweeping 360° views of the city, peninsula, and ocean.

activities.name: Cape Peninsula & Cape Point Drive
activities.description: A full-day drive through Hout Bay, Boulder's Beach penguins, and Cape Point.

activities.name: Stellenbosch Wine Tasting
activities.description: South Africa's wine heartland — Pinotage, Chenin Blanc, and cellar tours.

activities.name: Robben Island Ferry Tour
activities.description: Ferry to the island where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned for 18 years.

activities.name: V&A Waterfront Evening
activities.description: Restaurants, craft beer, and live music at the redeveloped Victorian harbour.

name: Marrakech
description: Marrakech is a sensory explosion of winding medina lanes, riads, souks, and call-to-prayer echoing over terracotta rooftops. North Africa at its most vivid.
visa_notes: Australians receive visa-free entry for up to 90 days.
tips: Negotiate firmly but politely in the souks — first price is never final
Stay in a riad inside the medina for the full experience
Visit Djemaa el-Fna square at both midday and night — completely different atmosphere

activities.name: Djemaa el-Fna Square
activities.description: The main square transforms from acrobats and snake charmers by day to food stalls by night.

activities.name: Medina Souk Walk
activities.description: Lose yourself in the UNESCO-listed old city maze of spice markets and leather tanneries.

activities.name: Bahia Palace
activities.description: A stunning 19th-century palace with intricate Moroccan tilework and painted ceilings.

activities.name: Moroccan Cooking Class
activities.description: Learn to make tagine, harira soup, and bastilla in a traditional riad kitchen.

activities.name: Atlas Mountains Day Trip
activities.description: Berber villages, mountain waterfalls, and mule trekking 1 hour from the city.

name: Dubai
description: Dubai is a city of superlatives — the tallest building, the largest mall, the most ambitious archipelagos. A 30-year-old skyline built from desert ambition and oil wealth.
visa_notes: Australians receive a free 30-day visa on arrival.
tips: Visit October–March when it's cool enough to spend time outdoors
Dress modestly in malls, mosques, and public areas
The Dubai Metro is clean, fast, and air-conditioned — use it

activities.name: Burj Khalifa Observation Deck
activities.description: View from the top of the world's tallest building at 828m above the desert.

activities.name: Dubai Creek & Al Fahidi
activities.description: Old Dubai's historic trading district with wind tower architecture and the spice souk.

activities.name: Desert Safari & BBQ Dinner
activities.description: Dune bashing in 4WDs, camel riding, and a traditional Arabic dinner under the stars.

activities.name: Dubai Mall & Dubai Fountain
activities.description: One of the world's largest malls, with the world's biggest dancing fountain outside.

activities.name: Jumeirah Beach & Brunch
activities.description: Beach clubs, infinity pools, and the iconic Friday brunch culture of Dubai.

name: Hanoi
description: Vietnam's ancient capital is a city of lakes, shaded boulevards, and centuries of history. The Old Quarter's 36 guild streets remain largely unchanged, and the street food scene is arguably the best in Southeast Asia.
visa_notes: Australians can get an e-visa for Vietnam online before departure, valid for up to 90 days.
tips: Cross busy streets slowly and steadily — motorbikes will flow around you
Grab coffee at a bia hoi (street corner bar) for under $0.50
Book a Halong Bay overnight cruise early — the 2-night option is worth it

activities.name: Hoan Kiem Lake & Ngoc Son Temple
activities.description: The heart of Hanoi — a serene lake with a small temple on an island connected by a red bridge.

activities.name: Old Quarter Street Food Walk
activities.description: Pho, banh mi, bun cha, and egg coffee across the 36 guild streets of the ancient quarter.

activities.name: Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum Complex
activities.description: A vast complex including the mausoleum, the Presidential Palace, and Ho Chi Minh's stilt house.

activities.name: Halong Bay Overnight Cruise
activities.description: Limestone karsts rising from emerald water — one of the world's iconic natural wonders.

activities.name: Hanoi Cooking Class
activities.description: Learn to make pho, spring rolls, and banh xeo in a traditional family kitchen.

activities.name: Temple of Literature
activities.description: Vietnam's first national university, founded in 1070 — beautifully preserved Confucian courtyards.

name: Hoi An
description: Hoi An is Vietnam's most photogenic town — lantern-lit streets, centuries-old merchant houses, and some of the country's best tailoring and cuisine. Slower and more relaxed than the big cities.
visa_notes: Australians can get an e-visa for Vietnam online before departure, valid for up to 90 days.
tips: Get custom clothes tailored — give the tailor 48 hours minimum and do a fitting
Hire a bicycle to reach An Bang Beach — only 4km from town
The Ancient Town is best at dawn and dusk when tour groups thin out

activities.name: Hoi An Ancient Town Night Walk
activities.description: UNESCO-listed old town lit by hundreds of silk lanterns — magical at night.

activities.name: Cao Lau & White Rose Dumplings
activities.description: Hoi An's two signature dishes — only authentic when made with local well water.

activities.name: My Son Sanctuary Day Trip
activities.description: Ancient Hindu Cham towers in the jungle — Vietnam's answer to Angkor.

activities.name: Cooking Class at Morning Market
activities.description: Shop at the market with a chef, then cook a 5-course Vietnamese meal from scratch.

activities.name: An Bang Beach Day
activities.description: A quiet stretch of beach 4km from town with beachside restaurants and clear water.

activities.name: Basket Boat Tour in Cam Thanh
activities.description: Traditional round wicker boats through the coconut palm water forest — locals do tricks.

name: Bangkok
description: Bangkok is chaotic, beautiful, and endlessly rewarding. Grand temples, floating markets, a rooftop bar skyline, and the world's best street food all exist within a few kilometres of each other.
visa_notes: Australians receive a free 60-day visa on arrival (extended from 30 days as of 2024).
tips: Use the BTS Skytrain and MRT metro to avoid traffic — Bangkok traffic is infamous
Tuk-tuks are for atmosphere not efficiency — always agree on price before getting in
Respect temple dress codes — cover shoulders and knees

activities.name: Grand Palace & Wat Phra Kaew
activities.description: Thailand's most sacred temple complex housing the Emerald Buddha inside the Royal Palace grounds.

activities.name: Chatuchak Weekend Market
activities.description: One of the world's largest markets — 15,000 stalls of everything imaginable.

activities.name: Floating Market at Damnoen Saduak
activities.description: Vendors selling fresh produce and cooked food from traditional wooden boats on the canals.

activities.name: Yaowarat (Chinatown) Night Food Walk
activities.description: Bangkok's Chinatown explodes after dark with seafood, roasted duck, and mango sticky rice.

activities.name: Rooftop Bar at Lebua Sky Bar
activities.description: 200m above the city — the bar from The Hangover 2 with unforgettable Bangkok views.

activities.name: Muay Thai Boxing Evening
activities.description: A live Muay Thai bout at Rajadamnern or Lumpinee stadium — raw and electric.

name: Phuket
description: Thailand's largest island offers turquoise Andaman Sea waters, limestone cliffs, and lively beach towns. The ideal base for island hopping, diving, and beach relaxation.
visa_notes: Australians receive a free 60-day visa on arrival.
tips: Stay in Kata or Kamala for a calmer beach than Patong
Rent a scooter to explore hidden beaches — international licence required
Avoid jet skis — scams and injuries are common

activities.name: Phi Phi Island Day Trip
activities.description: Speedboat to the emerald-green lagoons and white sand of Koh Phi Phi.

activities.name: Phang Nga Bay Kayaking
activities.description: Sea kayak through mangroves and into hidden sea caves in James Bond Bay.

activities.name: Patong Beach & Bangla Road
activities.description: Phuket's famous nightlife strip — colourful, chaotic, and unforgettable.

activities.name: Big Buddha & Old Phuket Town
activities.description: A 45m marble statue with panoramic views, then Sino-Portuguese heritage buildings in the old town.

activities.name: Scuba Diving at Similan Islands
activities.description: World-class diving with manta rays, leopard sharks, and visibility up to 30m.

name: Queenstown
description: Queenstown is the adventure capital of the world — bungee jumping, skydiving, and skiing all within reach. Set on the shore of Lake Wakatipu surrounded by the Remarkables mountain range.
visa_notes: Australians do not need a visa to enter New Zealand — Australian citizens can live and work there indefinitely.
tips: Book adventure activities in advance, especially in peak summer/ski season
Hire a car — the drive to Milford Sound and Wanaka is as scenic as the destination
Try a Fergburger — the queue is real but so is the reward

activities.name: AJ Hackett Bungee at Kawarau Bridge
activities.description: The original commercial bungee jump, 43m above the turquoise Kawarau River.

activities.name: Skydive Queenstown
activities.description: Tandem skydive from 15,000ft over the Remarkables, Lake Wakatipu, and Mount Cook.

activities.name: Milford Sound Day Trip
activities.description: UNESCO World Heritage fiord with sheer 1200m cliffs, waterfalls, and dolphins.

activities.name: Coronet Peak Ski Day
activities.description: Queenstown's most accessible ski resort — 25 runs across all skill levels, open June–October.

activities.name: Shotover Jet Boat
activities.description: High-speed jet boat through narrow rocky canyons with 360° spins.

activities.name: Queenstown Hill Walk
activities.description: A free hike giving panoramic views of the lake, the Remarkables, and the town below.

name: Cusco
description: Cusco was the capital of the Inca Empire and remains one of the most remarkable living heritage cities on earth. The gateway to Machu Picchu, with Andean food, colonial architecture, and high-altitude adventure.
visa_notes: Australians receive a free tourist stamp on arrival valid for up to 183 days.
tips: Spend 2–3 days acclimatising to altitude (3,400m) before any strenuous activity
Drink coca tea — locals swear by it for altitude sickness
Book the Inca Trail 6+ months ahead; the Sun Gate and Huayna Picchu require advance permits

activities.name: Machu Picchu Full Day
activities.description: The ancient Inca citadel at 2,430m — one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.

activities.name: Sacred Valley & Pisac Market
activities.description: Inca ruins, weaving communities, and a vibrant artisan market 30km from Cusco.

activities.name: Inca Trail Trek
activities.description: The classic 4-day Inca Trail trek through cloud forest and mountain passes to Machu Picchu.

activities.name: San Pedro Market Breakfast
activities.description: A local covered market with fresh juices, tamales, and quinoa porridge for under $3.

activities.name: Sacsayhuamán Fortress
activities.description: Massive zigzag Inca walls above Cusco, built from stones weighing up to 300 tonnes.

activities.name: Rainbow Mountain Hike
activities.description: A stunning striped mountain of coloured minerals at 5,200m — a full-day guided hike.

name: Athens
description: Athens is the cradle of Western civilisation — and after a decade of reinvention, one of Europe's most exciting cities for food and nightlife too. The Acropolis still dominates the skyline as it has for 2,500 years.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Schengen countries visa-free for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
tips: Buy the combined archaeological ticket — it covers the Acropolis, Agora, and 4 other sites
Visit the Acropolis at opening time (8am) or the last hour before closing to beat the heat and crowds
Athens is an ideal base — day trips to Santorini, Delphi, and Mycenae are all feasible

activities.name: Acropolis & Parthenon
activities.description: The 5th-century BC Parthenon temple perched above the city — the defining monument of ancient Greece.

activities.name: Acropolis Museum
activities.description: World-class museum built over excavations, housing original Parthenon friezes and artefacts.

activities.name: Monastiraki Flea Market & Psiri Food Walk
activities.description: Athens' bohemian quarter — souvlaki, spanakopita, and loukoumades (honey doughnuts).

activities.name: Cape Sounion Sunset
activities.description: The Temple of Poseidon on a clifftop 70km from Athens — best seen at golden hour.

activities.name: Santorini Day Trip by Ferry
activities.description: High-speed ferry to the famous caldera island — Oia, black sand beaches, and volcanic wine.

activities.name: Athenian Street Food Tour
activities.description: Guided tour of Athens' best street food from tiropita to bougatsa pastry.

name: Lisbon
description: Lisbon is sun-drenched, hilly, and melancholic in the best way. Portugal's capital is one of Europe's most affordable and charming cities, built across seven hills over the Tagus estuary.
visa_notes: Australians can visit Schengen countries visa-free for up to 90 days in any 180-day period.
tips: Get a 24-hour Viva Viagem card for trams and metro
Ride tram 28 for a scenic tour through the old neighbourhoods
Pastéis de Nata (custard tarts) are best at Pastéis de Belém

activities.name: Belém Tower & Jerónimos Monastery
activities.description: UNESCO-listed Manueline-style monuments at the edge of the Tagus.

activities.name: Alfama District & Fado Show
activities.description: Lisbon's ancient Moorish quarter where fado music was born — haunting and beautiful.

activities.name: Sintra Day Trip
activities.description: Fairy-tale palaces in a forested mountain town 40 minutes from Lisbon.

activities.name: LX Factory Sunday Market
activities.description: Vintage clothes, street food, and live music in a reclaimed industrial complex.

activities.name: Pastéis de Nata & Coffee Crawl
activities.description: Sample Portugal's famous custard tarts fresh from the oven across the city's best cafés.

activities.name: Miradouro da Graça at Sunset
activities.description: The best viewpoint in Lisbon — locals gather here at golden hour with wine.
